subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The players union has discovered that at least 22 teams require players to make donations, something it says violates the Basic Agreement. Manny Ramírez signed a two-year, $45 million contract with the Los Angeles Dodgers this month, then donated $1 million to the Dodgers Dream Foundation. The union filed a grievance after Frank McCourt, the Dodgers’ owner, said “every future Dodger” would make a donation.
